parts: I need an app that tracks my workouts but also tells me when to rest based on my sleep data. Like if I slept badly, it should adjust my workout intensity.
Can you help me design a feature where it syncs with my Apple Watch to get HRV data?
I hate meal planning. I wish there was an app that just told me what to eat based on what's in my fridge and my nutrition goals.
Something that scans my fridge with my phone camera and suggests recipes would be amazing
I need a budgeting app that doesn't make me feel guilty. Something that focuses on reflection rather than restriction.
Weekly money check-ins where I just reflect on how I feel about my spending, not track every penny
Every habit tracker I've tried is too gamified. I don't want streaks. I want something gentle that doesn't make me feel bad when I miss a day.
Maybe something that tracks patterns over time without daily pressure? Like monthly reviews instead?
I want to learn about yield farming but everything online is too complicated or trying to sell me something
Is there an app that teaches DeFi concepts in a structured way without pushing specific protocols?
My back is killing me from sitting all day. I need something that reminds me to stretch and shows me the right exercises.
Like a virtual physio that watches my form and corrects me
I keep forgetting my dog's medication schedule. I need an app specifically for pet health tracking.
Track vet appointments, medications, vaccinations, all in one place. Nothing like this exists that isn't cluttered.
I want to read more but I never remember what I read. I need an app that helps me take notes and retain information from books.
Something that quizzes me on key concepts from books I've read would be cool
I have like 50 side project ideas but no way to organize them. I need an app that helps me prioritize and actually ship things.
Something that breaks down projects into small tasks and reminds me to work on them
I need something that analyzes my sleep patterns and gives me actionable advice. Not just 'you slept 6 hours' but 'here's why and here's what to do'
Correlate sleep with caffeine intake, screen time, exercise, etc.
I want a journaling app that uses AI to ask me follow-up questions based on what I write. Make it feel like talking to a therapist.
And then it shows me patterns over time - like 'you mention work stress 3x more on Mondays'
I can't focus anymore. I need an app that blocks distractions but in a smart way - not just blocking sites but understanding when I need breaks.
Maybe it learns my productivity patterns and suggests optimal focus windows?
I want to get better at cooking but YouTube tutorials are too long. I need something that teaches cooking techniques in bite-sized lessons.
Like Duolingo but for cooking. Progressive skill building.
As an introvert, I need to manage my social energy. An app that helps me track social events and warns me when I'm overcommitting.
Something that suggests recharge time after draining events
I never drink enough water. I need reminders but smart ones - not just every 2 hours but based on my activity level and weather.
I have so many subscriptions I've lost track. I need an app that finds all my recurring charges and helps me cancel the ones I don't use.
Auto-detect from my bank transactions and show me total monthly cost
I need an app that automatically summarizes my meetings and extracts action items. Something that integrates with Zoom/Google Meet.
I want an app that catalogs my wardrobe and suggests outfits based on weather, calendar events, and what I haven't worn recently.
Photo my clothes once and it remembers everything. AI outfit suggestions daily.
I want to practice gratitude but I forget. Need an app with gentle evening prompts that don't feel like a chore.
Duolingo is too repetitive. I want a language app that teaches me words I'll actually use based on my interests and upcoming travel.
Like if I'm going to Japan, teach me restaurant Japanese and train station vocabulary, not random words
